events.message: The customer reported a car accident that occurred at an intersection involving their vehicle and another driver.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report and damage description.
A claims agent was assigned to the case to assist the customer with the auto accident claim process.
The insurer sent an acknowledgment letter confirming receipt of the auto accident claim and next steps.
Additional documents including the police report, vehicle photos, and driver statements were requested.
The customer submitted all requested documents, including accident photos and the official police report.
The claims team initiated investigation activities to verify damage and assess liability for the collision.
The investigation concluded with confirmation of fault and estimated repair costs for the vehicle.
A settlement offer addressing vehicle repairs and rental car reimbursement was proposed to the claimant.
The customer responded positively to the settlement proposal and expressed satisfaction with the process.
The claim was officially approved following confirmation of settlement acceptance by the customer.
Payment for damages and associated costs was issued to the customer as per the approved settlement.
The auto accident claim case was closed after confirmation of payment and customer satisfaction.
All case files and documentation were archived for future reference in accordance with company policy.
